verses.roman:
rādhā-premā vibhu--yāra bāḍite nāhi ṭhāñi
tathāpi se kṣaṇe kṣaṇe bāḍaye sadāi

synonyms: rādhā-premā—the love of Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī; vibhu—all-pervading; yāra—of which; bāḍite—to increase; nāhi—there is not; ṭhāñi—space; tathāpi—still; se—that; kṣaṇe kṣaṇe—every second; bāḍaye—increases; sadāi—always.
translation: "Rādhā's love is all-pervading, leaving no room for expansion. But still it is expanding constantly.
